pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:0.4: The sub-chapter on hands on hips
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:0.5: 23. The training rule on covering the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their heads with their upper robes while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.3.1: “‘I will not cover my head while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.4: One should not cover one’s head while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his head with his upper robe while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk23:1.9: The third training rule is finished.
